children: A 25-year-old woman is evaluated for altered mentation, fever, and new-onset seizures.
Which of the following is the most likely diagnosis?

The most likely diagnosis is herpes simplex encephalitis. This patient's MRI scan reveals hyperintense areas in the left temporal lobe and insular area. Temporal lobe lesions are suggestive of herpes simplex encephalitis; lesions are predominantly unilateral and may have associated mass effects. MRI is the most sensitive and specific imaging method for diagnosing herpes simplex encephalitis, especially early in the disease course, although normal MRI findings have also been reported. Cranial CT of the brain has only 50% sensitivity early in the disease.
